channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: On Bruno Latour (1947-2022)
item.description: The arc of Latour's career and theory.

item.title: Plato's Dashboards
item.description: System dashboards select 'surrogate metrics,' which depend on context; they make bad OKRs.

item.title: Call It Sour Grapes
item.description: A professor at a mid-ranked school on preferring his research to that at top programs.

item.title: Scenius, or Communal Genius
item.description: Unnecessary neologism, but cool examples of 'scenes.'

item.title: Potluck: Dynamic documents as personal software
item.description: A well-structured tool for dynamic documents (with sliders, calculations, etc).

item.title: Hiding Theory in Practice
item.description: Using unorthodox (e.g. blamey) contributions in postmortems: ways they're useful.

item.title: Spiral Motion: On Dmitrii Furman
item.description: Ultimate test of democracy: the opposition winning. Yeltsin seemed pro-democratic, but never desired or achieved this.

item.title: The Degradation Drug
item.description: A dopamine agonist triggers obsessive, eccentric behaviors, which messes with nottions of mental health and culpability.

item.title: Why Is Everything So Ugly?
item.description: The foul ugliness of 'premium mediocre,' digital commercialism, and Urgent Care.

item.title: HUMAN_FALLBACK
item.description: Backing up a chatbot pretending to be human.

item.title: In Flanders Fields
item.description: Poem about WWI: "Loved and were loved, and now we lie, / In Flanders fields.'
